skill.name: gmail-tools
skill.description: Reading and managing Gmail emails - Sending emails with attachments - Replying to emails while maintaining thread continuity
skill.summary: Reading and managing Gmail emails - Sending emails with attachments - Replying to emails while maint...
skill.author: ClementWalter

security_audit.summary: The Gmail Tools skill provides legitimate email management functionality through standard IMAP/SMTP protocols. It uses 1Password for secure credential storage with hardcoded subprocess calls to the official 1Password CLI. All network operations connect directly to Gmail's official servers. No obfuscation, data exfiltration, or malicious patterns found.

medium_findings.title: External credential retrieval via subprocess
medium_findings.description: Scripts execute 1Password CLI to retrieve credentials. While legitimate, this represents dependency on external tool.

low_findings.title: Hardcoded Gmail server addresses
low_findings.description: Scripts use imap.gmail.com and smtp.gmail.com - expected for Gmail-specific skill.

content.value_statement: Tired of juggling email credentials across multiple tools? This skill provides secure Gmail access using 1Password for credential management, eliminating the need to store passwords in plain text while enabling powerful email automation.
actual_capabilities: List recent emails from any Gmail folder with configurable limits
Read full email content including HTML and text bodies with headers
Send new emails with file attachments via secure SMTP connection
Reply to emails maintaining proper thread continuity with In-Reply-To headers
Search emails using standard IMAP query syntax for quick retrieval
Secure credential storage through 1Password CLI integration
limitations: Requires Gmail App Password with 2FA enabled on Google account
Depends on 1Password CLI being installed and configured on system
Gmail-specific implementation not compatible with other email providers
IMAP access must be enabled in Gmail settings for full functionality

use_cases.title: Automate email responses
use_cases.description: Quickly reply to common inquiries while maintaining professional threading and adding attachments when needed.

use_cases.title: Integrate email into workflows
use_cases.description: Incorporate email notifications, reports, and updates directly into development scripts and automation pipelines.

use_cases.title: Track project communications
use_cases.description: Search and organize project-related emails, ensuring important updates are never missed in the inbox.

prompt_templates.title: List recent emails
prompt_templates.prompt: Use gmail-tools to list the 10 most recent emails from my Gmail Work account

prompt_templates.title: Read specific email
prompt_templates.prompt: Read email ID 123 from my Gmail Personal account to see the full message

prompt_templates.title: Send with attachment
prompt_templates.prompt: Send an email from Gmail Work to team@company.com with subject Monthly Report and attach /path/to/report.pdf

prompt_templates.title: Reply maintaining thread
prompt_templates.prompt: Reply to email ID 45 in my Gmail Work account with body Thank you for your inquiry. I will review and get back to you shortly.

best_practices: Always use --dry-run when testing email replies to verify content before sending
Store 1Password item names in environment variables for easier account switching
Use specific IMAP search queries like FROM sender or UNSEEN to find emails quickly
anti_patterns: Never use your main Google password - always generate App Passwords for security
Avoid hardcoding email addresses in scripts - use configuration files instead
Do not process emails in bulk without reviewing - always verify recipients before sending

faq.question: Is this compatible with Google Workspace accounts?
faq.answer: Yes, works with both personal Gmail and Google Workspace accounts as long as IMAP is enabled.

faq.question: What is the email sending limit?
faq.answer: Limited by Gmail daily quota: 500 emails per day for Gmail, 2000 for Workspace accounts.

faq.question: Can I use this with other password managers?
faq.answer: Currently only supports 1Password CLI. Other managers would require code modifications.

faq.question: How are my credentials protected?
faq.answer: Credentials are never stored in plain text. They are retrieved securely from 1Password and used only for the current operation.

faq.question: What if I get authentication errors?
faq.answer: Ensure 2FA is enabled, you are using an App Password not regular password, and IMAP access is enabled.

faq.question: How does this compare to Gmail API?
faq.answer: Uses standard IMAP/SMTP protocols instead of Gmail API, avoiding complex OAuth setup while maintaining security through 1Password.
